'''Gárulf''' was a Man of [[Rohan]] during the [[War of the Ring]].

==History==
Gárulf was a rider in the ''[[Éored]]'' of [[Éomer]], [[Third Marshal of the Riddermark]]. His ''Éored'' [[Ambush at Fangorn Forest‎|attacked and slaughtered]] the [[Uruk-hai]] of [[Uglúk]] under the eaves of [[Fangorn Forest]], where Gárulf was killed. His horse [[Hasufel]] was given to [[Aragorn]] by Éomer when they first met in [[the Wold]].<ref>{{TT|Riders}}</ref>

==Etymology==
''Gárulf'' is [[Old English]] for "spear-wolf". It was a name of a jutish warrior in the ''[[Beowulf and the Finnsburg Fragment|Finnsburg Fragment]]''.
